Dear Ms. Johnson:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
8/9/17. The inspection has determined substantial compliance with applicable licensing
statutes and rules, sections of the contract and ISEP requirements. It should be noted
that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the ISEP and your contract.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (248) 975-5053.
Sincerely,
James Gale, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
235 Grand, Ste 407
P.O. Box 30650
Lansing, MI 48909
(517) 284-9747

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MSA violation. Please note that there are
additional MSA requirements that may not be included in section 1. The facility is in
compliance will all additional MSA requirements.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHS Contract/Policy violation. Please note
that there are additional DHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be included
in section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHS Contract/Policy
requirements except for the following:
The contract monitor reviews this agency for compliance with their shelter contract.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was not offered technical assistance.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was not offered consultation.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this
licensing period.
The renewal inspection was completed on 5/11/17. The following rule citation
was made which required a corrective action plan.
R 400.4109 Program statement.
(1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents'
needs, implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of
residents.
It was identified in two youth records where at initial assessment
it was noted that the youth had a history of depression and
suicide attempts/ideation. It was not clear that this information
was immediately shared with the social service supervisor or
agency director. This consultant felt any youth presenting with a
1

history of depression/suicide should be immediately assessed
by a staff more qualified than a direct care worker. In some
situations it could two days before the social services supervisor
reviews a youth’s initial admission documentation. A corrective
action plan was required to address this issue.
The agency submitted a satisfactory corrective action plan to
address citation. This interim inspection found the agency
compliant with this rule.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or MSA requirements and/or contract and policy. It is
recommended that the facility continue on their regular license.
______________________________________8/16/17__
James B. Gale Date
